p:
A significant number of those diagnosed with COVID-19 have reported a broad spectrum of neurological consequences
26– 32 . Neurological symptoms include those associated with dysfunction of the central (fatigue, headache, confusion, stroke
33 , dizziness, syncope
34 , seizure, anorexia, and insomnia)
35– 38 , peripheral (anosmia, ageusia, myoclonus
39 , neuropathic pain, and myalgias)
26, 35, 40 , combined central-peripheral (Guillain Barre syndrome
41 ) and enteric nervous systems (diarrhea
13 ). Some gastrointestinal manifestations, including diarrhea, may be related to the expression of the viral receptor ACE2 and a serine protease, transmembrane serine protease 2 (TMPRSS2), involved in S protein priming, in the small intestinal epithelia and colon
42 .
